metadata.name: Honey Extension
metadata.description: Automated coupon application, affiliate tracking, install reporting, and rewards management.

endpoints.purpose: External redirect endpoint for affiliate link hijacking
Get canonical products by cluster ID
Get product inventory by store and parent ID

keys.purpose: Store gift card reminder states by store
Track coupon autopop suppression by session
Store framework metadata by store ID
Double gold store activation by user and store
Store NNA settings by user and store
User points balance by user ID
Redeemable gold balance by payer and currency
User store sessions by user ID
Last HPID call parameters by tab
Last HPID call results by tab

workflows.name: Affiliate Link Hijacking Flow
triggers: User visits any website with affiliate links
User clicks on product links on 87+ supported retailers
steps: Content script monitors all HTTP/HTTPS sites for affiliate link opportunities
Extension identifies supported retailers and existing affiliate links
Background service worker coordinates affiliate link replacement via affManager:tag message
Original affiliate links are replaced with Honey tracking URLs
User clicks are routed through out.joinhoney.com redirect infrastructure
Honey captures affiliate commissions from displaced marketers
Success reported via stores:affiliate:tagged message with affUrl confirmation

workflows.name: Coupon Application Flow
steps: Content script (h1-check.js) detects cart/checkout page
Applies coupon codes via hardcoded endpoints
Updates DOM price fields to reflect discounts
No direct Chrome messaging; all logic is local to content script

workflows.name: Affiliate Tagging & Tracking Flow
steps: Service worker (h0.js) listens for store/session events
Sends affiliate tagging requests to remote endpoints
Tracks session, coupon, and user identifiers
Reports events to Honey backend and third-party endpoints

workflows.name: Offscreen Tagging Flow
triggers: Service worker needs to perform DOM operations not allowed in background
steps: Service worker sends 'offscreen:tag' message to offscreen document (h1-offscreen.js)
Offscreen document performs DOM tagging and responds with 'offscreen:tag:success'
Service worker continues affiliate/session logic

workflows.name: Device/Install Reporting Flow
steps: Service worker listens for install/update events
Reports install/update to Honey backend
Sets device/user IDs in chrome.storage.local/sync
Handles onboarding and welcome flows

workflows.name: Gold/Rewards Activation Flow
triggers: User activates Gold/rewards on supported store
steps: Service worker listens for rewardsManager:action, stores:session:activated
Activates Gold/rewards via GraphQL endpoints
Updates local storage with activation state
Reports activation to backend

workflows.name: Honey Pay Now Financial Flow
triggers: User initiates checkout with Honey Pay Now
steps: Extension checks payment eligibility based on cart price and store
Executes GraphQL queries for payment options and terms
Manages payment UI visibility and modal interactions
Stores payment-related data in local storage
Coordinates PayPal integration and payment processing

workflows.name: User Experimentation and A/B Testing Flow
steps: Extension evaluates active experiments for user
Assigns user to experiment groups based on criteria
Tracks experiment interactions and outcomes
Reports experiment data to analytics backend
Modifies UI/behavior based on experiment assignment

workflows.name: User Account Management Flow
steps: Captures user credentials and authentication data
Manages user session state and preferences
Handles opt-out preferences and privacy settings
Syncs user data across devices via chrome.storage.sync
Reports user actions and profile changes to backend

workflows.name: Site Support and UGC Monitoring Flow
steps: Extension monitors for site support requests
Watches for User Generated Content (UGC) coupon submissions
Validates UGC coupons against store policies
Reports site issues and user feedback to backend
Manages continuous site monitoring for changes

privacy.minimization: Excessive data collection beyond disclosed coupon functionality. Systematically captures and redirects affiliate links across 87+ retailers without user disclosure. Collects financial data through Honey Pay Now integration.
privacy.consent: No explicit consent mechanism for affiliate link replacement, financial data collection, or user experimentation. Users unaware of commission capture and A/B testing occurring during normal browsing.
privacy.retention: Indefinite storage of affiliate relationships, user session data, and financial information with no cleanup observed

third_parties.name: out.joinhoney.com
third_parties.purpose: Affiliate link redirection and commission capture infrastructure

third_parties.name: api.joinhoney.com
third_parties.purpose: Coupon data retrieval and affiliate coordination

privacy.policy_compliance: Potential violations of affiliate program terms, FTC disclosure requirements, and user consent standards. Operates undisclosed commission capture system.

risks.justification: Extension systematically replaces existing affiliate links across 87+ retailers without user disclosure, potentially violating affiliate program terms and displacing legitimate content creators' revenue. Operates through sophisticated redirect infrastructure via out.joinhoney.com.

Extension captures and transmits sensitive financial information including payment credentials, cart contents, and payment eligibility data through Honey Pay Now integration. Stores PayPal heartbeat data and redeemable balance information.
Extension transmits cart/order and user/session data to third-party endpoints for coupon application and affiliate tracking without explicit user consent.

Extension requests broad host permissions for all websites (<all_urls>) enabling comprehensive browsing surveillance beyond stated coupon functionality. Monitors all HTTP/HTTPS traffic for affiliate link detection.
Session, device, and user identifiers are transmitted to Honey backend and stored locally, potentially without user awareness or retention limits.
Extension conducts extensive A/B testing and experimentation on users without explicit consent, tracking user behavior patterns and modifying functionality based on experiment assignments.
